comment: Really awesome prof who is very knowledgable. Pretty easy class as you don't have to know dates and only a hand full of names to pass the test. Just take good notes and do some light studying and you'll get an A.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Donna Hamil is a good professor. She explains the material well in her lectures and posts the PowerPoints at the end of the week for us to review. If you make sure you complete all of the quick writes and discussion posts on time, you can get a good grade. There is a midterm and final, and as long as you go to class and take notes you should be ok.
rating_tags: Participation matters

comment: 2 exams, 2 quizzes, 2 discussions, 8 quick writes. Quick writes are easy and due every week unless its a discussion post week. Discussions are also easy. Quizzes and exams can be difficult and if you havent gone to class you probably wont do well. Shes super chill, no attendance policy but I recommend you go. Boring unless you like history.

Professor Hamil was an awesome professor. She posts her lecture slides at the end of the week but I strongly suggest attending class. Details in her lectures are important for the tests and weekly quickwrites. You need the lectures and the textbook to do well on the tests. The tests are HARD but if you study you should be okay! Very fun teacher!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: This class had very few assignments due and the tests were difficult but i'm not best listener. There are 7-8 10-min. lectures to watch every week, take detailed notes about main details of every civilization and you will easily pass, I struggled to get an A but the tests are a large % of the grade. She listens to emails so communicate, she cares!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: This class was ridiculously easy. There were 3 tests, 4 quizzes, 4 discussions, 4 quick writes and 1 essay (3-4 pgs). As long as you watch the lecture videos and turn everything in you shouldnt have a problem getting an A. Everything comes directly from the videos. Overall, Prof. Hamil was a very nice professor.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I took this prof's asynchronous class online and it was easy! As long as u listen to the lectures and read a bit of the textbook you'll be fine. Lecture vids were easy to follow and the discussion posts weren't long at all. She does have an essay question in each test but they're easy. This prof is also super understanding and is nice to talk to!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Graded primarily on discussions, short-answer papers, and extremely short quizzes. Clear grading criteria - but the quizzes are true/false and there's only about 5-10 questions each and the questions are so subtle. No extra credit / late work. 4 quizzes, 4 quick-writes, 4 discussions, and 3 exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: I can tell she a nice person who cares about her students but her test are ridiculous 1)3 tests all together they are worth 60% of your grade 2) The study doesn't help at all its just terms 3) Test require a 5 paragraph response to a question, which I find ridiculous you except your students to remember enough to write 5 paragraph over one question

I am sure that the professor is nice but I am taking her asynchronous online so I do not interact with her. This class really is making me hate history. You have to read 80 pg and watch 2 hours of videos each week. 3 exams, 1 paper, disc, quick writes. Exam is VERY difficult due to 5 paragraph essay worth 50 pts. Study guide not helpful. AVOID.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Professor Hamil is a fantastic history professor and is exactly what I wanted out of a world history class. Of course most of the class is reading and taking notes from a power point, but she makes it interesting and helps you understand each topic. Her class is easy if you take good notes and pay attention.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Hamil is really sweet and is always open to answering questions. Attendance is not mandatory, but you do need to participate 5 out of 10 days of class discussion days, which are based on the textbook. There are 3 tests and a written paper. I reccomend attending review days because she says exactly what you need for the test
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Participation matters

comment: She is a sweet lady! Attendence is not mandatory, but you should show up to class becasue she explains everything in well detail. There are only 3 test they are tough , but as long as you study you will pass. You do need the textbook for discussion questions, but some people got digital ones. Overall as long as you do your part you will be fine.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Very easy class so long as you go to most classes, fill out the study guide, and go to the test review sessions. Textbook used for group assignments. Power point and lecture heavy. Professor Hamil is a very sweet lady, she'll answer your questions clearly and her tests are easy so long as you did the study guide. Would definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Hamil is a marvelous teacher who is very passionate about history. She covers all the material in detail and goes out of her way to answer every question students ask. She also doesn't force students to come up and present (which there is alot of). However, the class is difficult. Tests are hard. Study the powerpoints and take notes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: I think she is a great professor and she is very passionate about history. She covered ancient history up to WW2 in great detail. She gives 2 exams, a paper, and the final. She offers an extra credit assignment which helps out a great deal. Overall, I think her class is a great choice.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Hamil is an alright professor; she is by no means extraordinary, but she does do a decent job considering that she has to cover ancient world history to modern in one semester. There are 3 tests and 1 paper, and although she covers a good amount of the material, a little bit of outside studying should be done to pass the class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: THIS CLASS IS HARD! If youre just looking to pass then take it, but if youre looking to make an A or B *easily* then dont. 3 tests and a paper, the tests cover way too much information which makes it nearly impossible to be fully prepared. You have to pick and choose what to study because theres just too much.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mrs. Dona is very sweet lady who cares about her students success. She gives a lot of opportunities to make you pass her class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Hamil is very noticeable passionate about History and she has a very likable personality. Pros: - Makes her PowerPoints available - Can make study guides straight from the PowerPoints - Attractive Professor - Group days with presentations for EC - Writes her own tests - Is very understanding Contras: - Lecture is PowerPoint heavy.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She's an amazing person & she really cares for her job and students. If you go to class everyday you will pass every assignment. Maybe not with an A but you will pass. Tests are blue book. If you're not a test taker stay away from her class. There's only 4 assignments: 3 tests, 1 paper
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Doctor Hamil's class is boring. There is no participation, only lectures. Three tests and a paper, no other grades. She has to cover ancient to modern history in one semester, so note taking is impossible. The tests are too broad, multiple choice/ essay. Study hard to earn an A.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Really easy, not a college level class
rating_tags: Respected--Caring

comment: She is ridiculously easy. I barely ever went to class and got an A. All you have to do is do the easy map quizzes (we only have like 3, and she gives us the guides) and do the midterm and final exam. Strongly recommend her, you'll be sorry if you didn't!
Highly recommend. Its an easy class, even if you just skim the reading.
